description: From Latin plaudite, second-person plural imperative of plaudere (“to applaud”).

entries.meaning: (often in the plural) A mark or expression of applause; praise bestowed.
examples: The roof now rung with bravos, handkerchiefs were waved on every side, “three cheers,” again and again, and plaudit upon plaudit following in such quick succession, begun, ended, and begun again, that it was some time before the toast with which Mr. Irving concluded, could be heard.
